Reishi , or Ganoderma lucidum, is often referred to as the "mushroom of immortality" in traditional Chinese medicine. Rich in triterpenes and beta-glucans, it is renowned for its immunomodulatory, anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. It [helps support the immune system](/en/369-complement-alimentaire-defenses-naturelles) , fight stress, and promote longevity. Shiitake , or Lentinula edodes, is not only a culinary delight but also a powerful ally for your health. It is particularly known for its content of lentinan, a polysaccharide which stimulates the immune system. Plus, it contains eritadenines, compounds that [help maintain healthy cholesterol levels](/en/96-cholesterol-pharmacie-troubles-lipido-cardio) . Maitake , or Grifola frondosa, is another nature gem. It is rich in beta-glucans, known for their immunostimulating properties. It also has beneficial effects on metabolic health and may help support healthy body weight. Finally, Cordyceps , particularly Cordyceps sinensis, is a unique mushroom that has the ability to improve vitality and energy. It is known to increase endurance, resistance to stress and lung capacity. It can also help maintain healthy sexual function. Hifas da Terra Bio-Defense is therefore a precious blend of these four mushrooms, which work in harmony to boost your well-being. It is therefore recommended that you consult a healthcare professional before using this product in these situations. - Before Surgery : Some ingredients in Bio-Defense may affect blood clotting, so it is recommended that you stop taking this product at least two weeks before scheduled surgery. - Drug interactions : Bio-Defense may interact with certain drugs, including immunosuppressive drugs and blood thinners. If you are taking prescription medication, consult your doctor before starting this supplement. - Diabetes : Bio-Defense could affect blood sugar control. People with diabetes, or taking medication for diabetes, should carefully monitor their blood sugar levels while taking this product and consult a healthcare practitioner. As always, it's important to remember that dietary supplements are not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease. It is always recommended to consult a healthcare professional before starting a new supplement, especially if you have any medical conditions or are taking other medications or supplements.
